sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's parliament passed a resolution on Saturday blocking the opening of voting stations ahead of Serbia's referendum aimed to boost the independence of its judiciary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: While ethnic Serbs in the territory may cast a ballot via mail or at liaison office, Kosovo's Assembly says Serbia is trying to instrumentalise and exploit Serb citizens in Kosovo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kosovo's Prime Minister Albin Kerti says the opening of Serbian polling stations in the Republic of Kosovo violates the sovereignty and constitutional order and is contrary to our constitution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Police in Pristina say they blocked documentation sent from Serbia that would have allowed the ethnic Serb minority in Kosovo to take part in the ballot this weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Serbia has insisted that Kosovo remains part of its country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: However, Kosovo declared independence following a 1998-99 conflict that killed some 13,000 people.

sentences.sentence: Germany is tightening restrictions on bars and restaurants in a bid to attack the surge in Omicron. Access will be limited to people who are fully vaccinated or recovered and can't produce a negative test.

sentences.sentence: It's really important to follow the rules, get vaccinated. I got my third one. I think that's the only way really to get out from this pandemic situation and we want back our freedom to go out and see people and see friends.

sentences.sentence: In Iceland, stricter COVID-19 restrictions started this week and are expected to run until at least the 2nd of February and premises that do not serve food will have to close completely again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: From there, the migrants aim to get to Mexico and finally to the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10

Shops along the coast have been damaged and a significant clean-up will be needed." Volcanic dust from the undersea eruption has reportedly polluted the water supply on Tonga, which was hit by waves of around 80 centimeters. The island's only internet connection runs underwater to Fiji and has been lost.

sentences.sentence: Tennis star Novak Djokovic expressed his disappointment after three Australian federal court judges upheld his visa cancellation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Djokovic's visa was cancelled by the Australian immigration minister Alex Hawke on public interest grounds because the athlete was not vaccinated against COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While rendering the verdict, the Chief Justice, James Alsop, said the court ruling was based on whether the minister's decision was irrational or legally unreasonable.

sentences.sentence: While Hawke welcomed the decision, many Djokovic supporters were left devastated and disappointed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Aviator Zara Rutherford is set to become the youngest woman to fly around the world solo

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: and the youngest woman to circumnavigate the globe in a microlight aircraft.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Having departed Belgium six months ago, the teenager avoided California's devastating fires, withstood Siberia's freezing temperatures and circumvented North Korean airspace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Belgian-British youth comes from a long line of pilots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: My granddad learned to fly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It was recreational.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: My dad learned to fly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It was also recreational.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I learned to fly recreational.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And Zara is this fourth pilot in the line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: My great grandmother was the very first woman to get a pilot's license in South Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The very first one, which is a big thing. And my grandmother was in the Women's Auxiliary Air Force during the war. In fact, she was one of those ladies moving. She had a above top secret security clearance. And she was one of the ladies pushing the airplanes around the big board of the South of Britain that you see occasionally in the film.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She was one of those ladies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In her single-seater Shark Arrow high-performance ultralight aircraft, Zara's journey has taken her across Europe, the Americas, and to the Far East.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Fueled with her desire to motivate young women and girls around the world to pursue careers in aviation, her parents say they have been closely monitoring their daughter's expedition and were impressed by her resilience and ability to change course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We're extremely proud. We're extremely proud, but not only of what she's done, because at every stage we were very aware that it was an attempt and that she might not succeed for whatever reason.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yes she's coming home but not for very long I don't think, she wants to study in the US and she has these aspirations eventually of course to be an astronaut. So if you love something set it free, give them wings. And I think we've done that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think we can safely say that we've given her wings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: With just the final leg of her journey to go, the aspiring space cadet hopes to have two Guinness World Records under her belt by Monday.
